7199f4a.description: Responses indicative of intrusion—LMHost file download, certain banners, Metasploit Meterpreter kill command detected, etc.

5d8f630.description: Identification of traffic related to numerous chat clients, irc, and possible check-in activity

af37eeb.description: Rules for attacks and vulnerabilities regarding DNS. Also category for abuse of the service for things such as tunneling.

046da61.description: Denial of Service attempt detection. Intended to catch inbound DOS activity, and outbound indications.

9d6f3a2.description: Exploits that are not covered in specific service category. Rules to detect direct exploits.

15158f6.description: Detect remote shellcode execution attempts. Remote shellcode relies on standard TCP/IP socket connections to allow the attacker access to the shell on the target machine.

a79291b.description: Rules for attacks, exploits, and vulnerabilities regarding FTP. Also includes basic none malicious FTP activity for logging purposes, such as login, etc.

2808034.description: Malware and Spyware related, no clear criminal intent.

1aeb6e4.description: Specific to mobile platforms: Malware and Spyware related, no clear criminal intent.

b4bf3f3.description: Malicious software that has clear criminal intent. Rules here detect malicious software that is in transit, active, infecting, attacking, updating, and whatever else we can detect on the wire.

f1a3b79.description: Rules for attacks and vulnerabilities related to VOIP environments.

8f9153c.description: Detect attacks and vulnerabilities in specific web applications

e47fd80.description: Detect attacks against Microsoft ActiveX controls and exploits targeting vulnerabilities in ActiveX controls

9d2f33f.description: Web client side attacks and vulnerabilities.

0d4c512.description: Rules for attacks and vulnerabilities against web servers.

eec9aa1.description: Traffic indicative of network based worm activity.

01a5bf8.description: Attacks and vulnerabilities regarding Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP).

699bed1.description: Logs HTTP protocol specific events, typically normal operation.

21b255f.description: Logs NFS (Network Filesystem) protocol specific events, typically normal operation.

bff1a55.description: Logs NTP (Network Time Protocol) specific events, typically normal operation.

f44826e.description: Rules for the identification, as well as attacks and vulnerabilities regarding the POP3 protocol. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

1f27f73.description: Rules that will log SMTP operations.

2730471.description: Provide audit level events that are useful for correlation and identifying interesting activity which may not be inherently malicious but is often observed in malware and other threats

6aa22d5.description: ICMP protocol specific events, typically associated with normal operations for logging purposes.

e562432.description: Logs SMB (Server Message Block) specific events, typically normal operation.

0fe51c0.description: Logs IPSec tunneling events, typically normal operation.

9aa717e.description: Logs Modbus protocol events, typically normal operation.

537ea06.description: Rules for the identification, as well as attacks and vulnerabilities regarding the IMAP protocol.

f200a57.description: Rules for the identification, as well as attacks, exploits and vulnerabilities regarding Netbios. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

218827b.description: RPC related attacks, vulnerabilities, and protocol detection. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

4c8db3e.description: Rules for attacks, exploits, and vulnerabilities regarding SMTP. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

7741f26.description: Rules for attacks, exploits, and vulnerabilities regarding SNMP. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

9b9f037.description: Rules for attacks, exploits, and vulnerabilities regarding SQL. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

b4b79b2.description: Rules for attacks and vulnerabilities regarding the TELNET service. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

509dbc0.description: Rules for attacks and vulnerabilities regarding the TFTP service. Also included are rules detecting basic activity of the protocol for logging purposes.

e649d09.description: Rules for matching on TLS events and anomalies.

0bbab15.description: Detect attacks, exploits attempts, and vulnerabilities related to supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) systems. Also contains non-malicious SCADA activity for logging purposes

cfef511.description: Rules for the identification of Peer-to-Peer traffic and attacks against. Including torrents, edonkey, Bittorrent, Gnutella, Limewire, etc.

e1bc960.description: Application Identification category. Includes signatures for applications like DropBox and Google Apps, etc. Also covers off port protocols, basic DLP such as credit card numbers and social security numbers.

cd52f5a.description: Detect activity related to sites that are pornographic or otherwise not appropriate for a work environment.

b6d4a5f.description: Various detectable DNS issues, not necessarily malicious.

99d33ad.description: Detect reconnaissance and probing from tools such as Nessus, Nikto, and other port scanning, tools

19db558.description: Detect various application layer transactional issues.

65c7e8a.description: Detect various issues with DNP3 protocol.

599cbf7.description: These are auto-generated from several sources of known and confirmed active Botnet and other Command and Control hosts. Updated daily, primary data source is Shadowserver.org.

deee35b.description: These are auto-generated from several sources of known and confirmed active Botnet and other Command and Control hosts. Updated daily, primary data source is Shadowserver.org. This set is grouped by destination-port.

305fa51.description: Common gaming traffic and various attacks against those games.

84b87f1.description: Based on a list of known compromised hosts that is confirmed and updated daily.

fff95c8.description: Active and short lived campaigns. This category covers exploit kits and malware that will be aged and removed quickly due to the short lived nature of the threat.

3a38db2.description: IP based rules for Dshield Identified attackers. Daily updated list of the DShield top attackers list.

79d6a51.description: Detects IP addresses on the Spamhaus DROP (Don’t Route or Peer) list. These lists are maintained daily.

f0277e9.description: Command and Control servers identified by the Threatview.io research team.

bdfac29.description: Collective Intelligence generated IP rules for blocking based upon cinsscore.com.

3e21ddf.description: This category is for signatures that are generated automatically from the 3CORESec team’s IP block lists.

f9ead59.description: IP Based rules for the identification of traffic to and from TOR exit nodes.
